# Online References for Sports Science & Biomechanics Papers

This document contains URLs, DOIs, and online references for the papers listed in `list-of-papers-about-sports-science-biomechanics.md`.

## Jump Performance & Force-Velocity Profiling

### 1. Balsalobre-Fernández, C, Glaister, M, and Lockey, RA (2015)

**Title:** The validity and reliability of an iPhone app for measuring vertical jump performance
**Journal:** J Sports Sci 33: 1574–1579, 2015
**DOI:** [10.1080/02640414.2014.996184](https://doi.org/10.1080/02640414.2014.996184)
**PubMed:** <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25555023/>
**Full Text:** <https://research.stmarys.ac.uk/1715/1/iPhone%20paper.pdf>
**Local PDF:** [2015_Balsalobre-Fernandez_iPhone-Vertical-Jump.pdf](./pdfs/smartphone-technology/2015_Balsalobre-Fernandez_iPhone-Vertical-Jump.pdf)
**Local Markdown:** [2015_Balsalobre-Fernandez_iPhone-Vertical-Jump.md](./markdown/smartphone-technology/2015_Balsalobre-Fernandez_iPhone-Vertical-Jump.md)

### 2. Jiménez-Reyes P, Samozino P, Brughelli M, Morin JB (2016)

**Title:** Effectiveness of an individualized training based on force-velocity profiling during jumping
**Journal:** Front Physiol. 2016;7:677
**DOI:** [10.3389/fphys.2016.00677](https://doi.org/10.3389/fphys.2016.00677)
**PubMed:** <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28119624/>
**Full Text (Open Access):** <https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/physiology/articles/10.3389/fphys.2016.00677/full>
**ResearchGate:** <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/312159718>
**Local PDF:** [2016_Jimenez-Reyes_Force-Velocity-Training.pdf](./pdfs/jump-performance/2016_Jimenez-Reyes_Force-Velocity-Training.pdf)
**Local Markdown:** [2016_Jimenez-Reyes_Force-Velocity-Training.md](./markdown/jump-performance/2016_Jimenez-Reyes_Force-Velocity-Training.md)

### 3. Samozino, P, Rejc, E, Di Prampero, PE, Belli, A, and Morin, JB (2012)

**Title:** Optimal force-velocity profile in ballistic movements--altius: citius or fortius?
**Journal:** Med Sci Sport Exerc 44: 313–322, 2012
**DOI:** [10.1249/MSS.0b013e31822d757a](https://doi.org/10.1249/MSS.0b013e31822d757a)
**PubMed:** <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21775909/>
**ResearchGate:** <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/51508458>

**Local PDF:** [2012_Samozino_Optimal-Force-Velocity-Profile.pdf](./pdfs/jump-performance/2012_Samozino_Optimal-Force-Velocity-Profile.pdf)
**Local Markdown:** [2012_Samozino_Optimal-Force-Velocity-Profile.md](./markdown/jump-performance/2012_Samozino_Optimal-Force-Velocity-Profile.md)

### 4. Samozino, P, Edouard, P, Sangnier, S, Brughelli, M, Gimenez, P, and Morin, JB (2014)

**Title:** Force-velocity profile: imbalance determination and effect on lower limb ballistic performance
**Journal:** Int J Sport Med 35: 505–510, 2014
**DOI:** [10.1055/s-0033-1354382](https://doi.org/10.1055/s-0033-1354382)
**PubMed:** <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24227123/>
**ResearchGate:** <https://www.researchgate.net/publication/258522939>

**Local PDF:** [2014_Samozino_FV-Imbalance.pdf](./pdfs/jump-performance/2014_Samozino_FV-Imbalance.pdf)
**Local Markdown:** [2014_Samozino_FV-Imbalance.md](./markdown/jump-performance/2014_Samozino_FV-Imbalance.md)

### 5. Morin, JB and Samozino, P (2016)

**Title:** Interpreting power-force-velocity profiles for individualized and specific training
**Journal:** Int J Sports Physiol Perform. 11: 267–272, 2016
**DOI:** [10.1123/ijspp.2015-0638](https://doi.org/10.1123/ijspp.2015-0638)

## Injury Prevention & Risk Assessment

### 30. Saw A, Halson S, Mujika I (2018)

**Title:** Monitoring Athletes during Training Camps: Observations and Translatable Strategies from Elite Road Cyclists and Swimmers
**Journal:** Sports \[Internet\]. 2018 Jul 20;6(3):63

## Notes

- **Open Access papers** are marked with PMC or ResearchGate links where full text is available
- **DOI links** provide permanent identifiers that can be used with institutional access
- Papers marked "Search needed for full reference" require additional searching to locate online versions
- Some conference proceedings may not have traditional DOIs but are available through institutional repositories
